availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James C. Rush (Munfordville, Hart County, Kentucky)

body.p: Baptist minister in Munfordville, Kentucky. Kentucky native. Married to Louisa J. Rush. Father of Arabilla D. Rush, Cad W. Rush, Mollie V. Rush, Mattie Rush, James P. Rush, and Ella Rush. Owned two enslaved females, ages 10 and 40 years old and three enslaved males, ages eight, six, and four years old. in 1860. Served as chaplain of the 9th Kentucky Infantry from November 1861 to November 1862.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville District No. 2, p. 131. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, District No. 2, p. 6. "At Advanced Age: The Rev. James C. Rush, a Baptist Minister, Dies," Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), October 28, 1899. Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0234.
